author: Elle Halliwell
title: Melbourne Cup fashion form guide: Giving top fillies the inside running on big best-dressed prizes
text:
IT’S almost as hard to pick as the winner of the Melbourne Cup but there is a formula to nabbing a coveted spot in the Myer Fashions on the Field finals.
All but Victoria’s State Finals have been decided and next month the competition will heat up at Flemington’s Melbourne Cup Carnival, which will see one fashionable racegoer dubbed the best-dressed filly for 2015.
With a $75,000 Lexus, Myer shopping voucher and Longines watch just some of the prizes awarded to the national winner, spending a few hundred on a dress and hat doesn’t seem like a stretch.
NSW’s Amy Robson took out the big prize on Oaks Day in 2012. But we’ve taken a look back at the past 15 winners of the coveted title and found the common features among their ensembles to help you choose the right look to get you closer to that once-in-a-lifetime prize.
Knee length, multicoloured frocks and sculptured headpieces (as opposed to traditional hat shapes) have featured most often in winning ensembles.
White and black are the dominant shades, however few ladies have managed to take out the title without at least a small splash of colour.
 Which hues in particular? Take your pick as pink, red, green, blue and orange have all appeared on winner’s frocks in recent years.
The odds on a skirt-and-top combo taking out the top prize are much lower than a dress, which has been victorious 11 out of the past 15 years. Likewise, headpieces are more often unique creations than pillboxes and fedoras.
Fashions in the Field winner Laura Gleich. Derby Day winner Brodie Worrell. Rosanna Faraci, who won Fashions on The Field in 2000, said while there were certain standards to adhere to it was the uniqueness of her look which she believes caught the judges’ eyes. A cheeky wink from the stage also didn’t hurt.
“It was a sunny day and representative of fashion and racing but with a twist,” she said. “I wanted it to represent my personality which was fun, fresh, happy and I think if you feel confident in what you’re wearing it shines through.
“I also walked down the catwalk and gave (Judge) Steve Vizard a wink.”
